Looking ahead to #LeiTot ➡️

"He sees the game from the highest level. I’ll miss him, he's an honest guy, a funny guy and a very talented player."

Brendan Rodgers gave an update on injuries to a number of senior players ahead of Sunday's #LeiArs clash 👇

Brendan Rodgers on the Premier League's 'Top Six'...

"If you’re talking financial, we’re not in that. But if you’re talking football, we are challenging that hierarchy. Our mentality is to disrupt that and be competitive." 👊 https://t.co/wEolzBagki

On our #LeiArs opponents 🔴

"Like a lot of teams, they’ve had really good moments and also gone through periods of inconsistency. He (Mikel Arteta) has done very well. There's always expectation at a club like Arsenal and in his first managerial role, he's coped with that." https://t.co/YXgpmcnBnB

"We’ll look to respond. The game last night is in the past. We're excited by the challenge of Arsenal. Let's see if we can get a win. One of the key attributes of this group is how we respond. We don’t dwell on disappointment and that’s shown in our results." 💪 https://t.co/knQUXOYqdF

On last night's defeat 💭

"The disappointment for us was that the game came at the wrong time. With the injuries we have, we don’t have the depth that other teams have. We’ve had a lot of injuries this season and we’ve got on with it. We’ll learn from it." https://t.co/PaWNzpjZgg

"It's as simple as that. I left a great club in Celtic to come here for the challenge of establishing Leicester as a club who can compete for the top places. It's flown by. I'm really happy with how we’ve worked and I’m excited for the future." 💬 https://t.co/vpI5LKwsaO

🗣️ How would you sum up your first two years at Leicester in two words, Brendan?

"Very enjoyable!" 😀 https://t.co/FZJVrDvGTt
